body_html:
If torch.multiprocessing follows the same rules as in the original multiprocessing, set_start_method should be called inside __main__.

multiprocessing.set_start_method(method):
Note that this should be called at most once, and it should be protected inside the if name == 'main' clause of the main module.

If you do that, this problem disappears.

REF: https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html#multiprocessing.set_start_method
body_text:
If torch.multiprocessing follows the same rules as in the original multiprocessing, set_start_method should be called inside __main__.

multiprocessing.set_start_method(method):
Note that this should be called at most once, and it should be protected inside the if name == 'main' clause of the main module.

If you do that, this problem disappears.
REF: https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html#multiprocessing.set_start_method
body:
If ``torch.multiprocessing`` follows the same rules as in the original ``multiprocessing``, ``set_start_method`` should be called inside ``__main__``.

> multiprocessing.set_start_method(method):
 Note that this should be called at most once, and it should be protected inside the if __name__ == '__main__' clause of the main module.

If you do that, this problem disappears.

REF: https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html#multiprocessing.set_start_method
